content.description: Hemoglobin is a highly conserved protein used by all mammals to transport oxygen. Table 1 was constructed by comparing the amino acid sequence in the hemoglobin molecules from five different mammal species.
content.question: Table 1. Hemoglobin amino acid differences among five different mammal species Species 1 Species 2 Species 3 Species 4 Species 5 Species 1 – 21 11 13 5 Species 2 – 18 17 20 Species 3 – 3 10 Species 4 – 12 Species 5 – Which of the following best describes the importance of the number of amino acid differences indicated in Table 1 ?

choices.label: They reflect the different environments where the organisms were captured.
They reflect the number of base pair changes in the <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
They reflect random changes due to translation errors.
They reflect the number of oxygen molecules each hemoglobin molecule carries.

content.answer: They reflect the number of base pair changes in the <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
